description: Get Spotify user-specific data and automate behaviors.

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Allows to get an access token.

args.name: client_id
args.info: The Client ID obtained from Spotify.

args.name: client_key
args.info: The Client Secret obtained from Spotify.

args.name: code
args.info: An authorization code that can be exchanged for an access token.

args.name: redirect_uri
args.info: The value of redirect_uri here must exactly match one of the values you entered when you registered your application, including upper/lowercase, terminating slashes, etc

blocks.name: refreshAccessToken
blocks.description: Allows to refresh access token.

args.name: client_id
args.info: The Client ID obtained from Spotify.

args.name: client_key
args.info: The Client Secret obtained from Spotify.

args.name: refresh_token
args.info: The refresh token returned from the getAccessToken method.

blocks.name: getTrackAudioFeatures
blocks.description: Get audio feature information for a single track identified by its unique Spotify ID.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: The Spotify ID for the track

blocks.name: getFeaturedPlaylists
blocks.description: Get a list of Spotify featured playlists.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: locale
args.info: The desired language, consisting of a lowercase ISO 639 language code and an uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, joined by an underscore.

args.name: country
args.info: A country: an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want the list of returned items to be relevant to a particular country.

args.name: timestamp
args.info: A timestamp in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss. Use this parameter to specify the user's local time to get results tailored for that specific date and time in the day.

blocks.name: getNewReleases
blocks.description: Get a list of new album releases featured in Spotify.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: country
args.info: A country: an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want the list of returned items to be relevant to a particular country.

blocks.name: getCategories
blocks.description: Get a list of categories used to tag items in Spotify.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: country
args.info: A country: an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want the list of returned items to be relevant to a particular country.

args.name: locale
args.info: The desired language, consisting of a lowercase ISO 639 language code and an uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, joined by an underscore.

blocks.name: getCategory
blocks.description: Get a single category used to tag items in Spotify.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: The Spotify category ID for the category.

args.name: country
args.info: A country: an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want the list of returned items to be relevant to a particular country.

args.name: locale
args.info: The desired language, consisting of a lowercase ISO 639 language code and an uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, joined by an underscore.

blocks.name: getCategoryPlaylists
blocks.description: Get a list of Spotify playlists tagged with a particular category.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: The Spotify category ID for the category.

args.name: country
args.info: A country: an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want the list of returned items to be relevant to a particular country.

blocks.name: getCurrentUserProfile
blocks.description: Get detailed profile information about the current user (including the current user’s username).

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

blocks.name: getFollowedArtists
blocks.description: Get the current user’s followed artists.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

blocks.name: followUser
blocks.description: Add the current user as a follower of one or more Spotify users.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: User Spotify ID.

blocks.name: followArtist
blocks.description: Add the current user as a follower of one or more artists.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: Artist Spotify ID.

blocks.name: unfollowUser
blocks.description: Remove the current user as a follower of one or more Spotify users.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: User Spotify ID.

blocks.name: unfollowArtist
blocks.description: Remove the current user as a follower of one or more artists.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: Artist Spotify ID.

blocks.name: checkFollowUser
blocks.description: Check to see if the current user is following one or more Spotify users.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: User Spotify ID.

blocks.name: checkFollowArtist
blocks.description: Check to see if the current user is following one or more artists.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: Artist Spotify ID.

blocks.name: followPlaylist
blocks.description: Add the current user as a follower of a playlist.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: owner_id
args.info: The Spotify user ID of the person who owns the playlist.

args.name: playlist_id
args.info: The Spotify ID of the playlist.

args.name: public
args.info: If true the playlist will be included in user's public playlists, if false it will remain private.

blocks.name: unfollowPlaylist
blocks.description: Remove the current user as a follower of a playlist.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: owner_id
args.info: The Spotify user ID of the person who owns the playlist.

args.name: playlist_id
args.info: The Spotify ID of the playlist.

blocks.name: saveTrack
blocks.description: Save one or more tracks to the current user’s “Your Music” library.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: A comma-separated list of the Spotify IDs.

blocks.name: getUserSavedTracks
blocks.description: Get a list of the songs saved in the current Spotify user’s “Your Music” library.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: market
args.info: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

blocks.name: removeSavedTracks
blocks.description: Remove one or more tracks from the current user’s “Your Music” library.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: A comma-separated list of the Spotify IDs.

blocks.name: checkSavedTrack
blocks.description: Check if one or more tracks is already saved in the current Spotify user’s “Your Music” library.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: A comma-separated list of the Spotify IDs.

blocks.name: saveAlbumForUser
blocks.description: Save one or more albums to the current user’s “Your Music” library.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: A comma-separated list of the Spotify IDs.

blocks.name: getUserSavedAlbums
blocks.description: Get a list of the albums saved in the current Spotify user’s “Your Music” library.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: market
args.info: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

blocks.name: removeSavedAlbum
blocks.description: Remove one or more albums from the current user’s “Your Music” library.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: A comma-separated list of the Spotify IDs.

blocks.name: checkSavedAlbum
blocks.description: Check if one or more albums is already saved in the current Spotify user’s “Your Music” library.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: A comma-separated list of the Spotify IDs.

blocks.name: getUserTopArtists
blocks.description: Get the current user’s top artists based on calculated affinity.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: time_range
args.info: Over what time frame the affinities are computed. Valid values: long_term (calculated from several years of data and including all new data as it becomes available), medium_term (approximately last 6 months), short_term (approximately last 4 weeks). Default: medium_term.

blocks.name: getUserTopTracks
blocks.description: Get the current user’s top tracks based on calculated affinity.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: time_range
args.info: Over what time frame the affinities are computed. Valid values: long_term (calculated from several years of data and including all new data as it becomes available), medium_term (approximately last 6 months), short_term (approximately last 4 weeks). Default: medium_term.

blocks.name: getRecommendations
blocks.description: Create a playlist-style listening experience based on seed artists, tracks and genres.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: seed_artists
args.info: A comma separated list of Spotify IDs for seed artists.

args.name: seed_genres
args.info: A comma separated list of any genres in the set of available genre seeds.

args.name: seed_tracks
args.info: A comma separated list of Spotify IDs for a seed track.

args.name: market
args.info: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

args.name: limit
args.info: The target size of the list of recommended tracks. For seeds with unusually small pools or when highly restrictive filtering is applied, it may be impossible to generate the requested number of recommended tracks. Debugging information for such cases is available in the response. Default: 20. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 100.

args.name: acousticness_min
args.info: A confidence measure from 0.0 to 1.0 of whether the track is acoustic. 1.0 represents high confidence the track is acoustic.

args.name: acousticness_max
args.info: A confidence measure from 0.0 to 1.0 of whether the track is acoustic. 1.0 represents high confidence the track is acoustic.

args.name: acousticness_target
args.info: A confidence measure from 0.0 to 1.0 of whether the track is acoustic. 1.0 represents high confidence the track is acoustic.

args.name: danceability_min
args.info: Danceability describes how suitable a track is for dancing based on a combination of musical elements including tempo, rhythm stability, beat strength, and overall regularity. A value of 0.0 is least danceable and 1.0 is most danceable.

args.name: danceability_max
args.info: Danceability describes how suitable a track is for dancing based on a combination of musical elements including tempo, rhythm stability, beat strength, and overall regularity. A value of 0.0 is least danceable and 1.0 is most danceable.

args.name: danceability_target
args.info: Danceability describes how suitable a track is for dancing based on a combination of musical elements including tempo, rhythm stability, beat strength, and overall regularity. A value of 0.0 is least danceable and 1.0 is most danceable.

args.name: duration_ms_min
args.info: The duration of the track in milliseconds.

args.name: duration_ms_max
args.info: The duration of the track in milliseconds.

args.name: duration_ms_target
args.info: The duration of the track in milliseconds.

args.name: energy_min
args.info: Energy is a measure from 0.0 to 1.0 and represents a perceptual measure of intensity and activity. Typically, energetic tracks feel fast, loud, and noisy.

args.name: energy_max
args.info: Energy is a measure from 0.0 to 1.0 and represents a perceptual measure of intensity and activity. Typically, energetic tracks feel fast, loud, and noisy.

args.name: energy_target
args.info: Energy is a measure from 0.0 to 1.0 and represents a perceptual measure of intensity and activity. Typically, energetic tracks feel fast, loud, and noisy.

args.name: instrumentalness_min
args.info: Predicts whether a track contains no vocals. 'Ooh' and 'aah' sounds are treated as instrumental in this context. Rap or spoken word tracks are clearly 'vocal'. The closer the instrumentalness value is to 1.0, the greater likelihood the track contains no vocal content. Values above 0.5 are intended to represent instrumental tracks, but confidence is higher as the value approaches 1.0.

args.name: instrumentalness_max
args.info: Predicts whether a track contains no vocals. 'Ooh' and 'aah' sounds are treated as instrumental in this context. Rap or spoken word tracks are clearly 'vocal'. The closer the instrumentalness value is to 1.0, the greater likelihood the track contains no vocal content. Values above 0.5 are intended to represent instrumental tracks, but confidence is higher as the value approaches 1.0.

args.name: instrumentalness_target
args.info: Predicts whether a track contains no vocals. 'Ooh' and 'aah' sounds are treated as instrumental in this context. Rap or spoken word tracks are clearly 'vocal'. The closer the instrumentalness value is to 1.0, the greater likelihood the track contains no vocal content. Values above 0.5 are intended to represent instrumental tracks, but confidence is higher as the value approaches 1.0.

args.name: key_min
args.info: The key the track is in. Integers map to pitches using standard Pitch Class notation.

args.name: key_max
args.info: The key the track is in. Integers map to pitches using standard Pitch Class notation.

args.name: key_target
args.info: The key the track is in. Integers map to pitches using standard Pitch Class notation.

args.name: liveness_min
args.info: Detects the presence of an audience in the recording. Higher liveness values represent an increased probability that the track was performed live. A value above 0.8 provides strong likelihood that the track is live.

args.name: liveness_max
args.info: Detects the presence of an audience in the recording. Higher liveness values represent an increased probability that the track was performed live. A value above 0.8 provides strong likelihood that the track is live.

args.name: liveness_target
args.info: Detects the presence of an audience in the recording. Higher liveness values represent an increased probability that the track was performed live. A value above 0.8 provides strong likelihood that the track is live.

args.name: loudness_min
args.info: The overall loudness of a track in decibels (dB). Loudness values are averaged across the entire track and are useful for comparing relative loudness of tracks. Loudness is the quality of a sound that is the primary psychological correlate of physical strength (amplitude). Values typical range between -60 and 0 db.

args.name: loudness_max
args.info: The overall loudness of a track in decibels (dB). Loudness values are averaged across the entire track and are useful for comparing relative loudness of tracks. Loudness is the quality of a sound that is the primary psychological correlate of physical strength (amplitude). Values typical range between -60 and 0 db.

args.name: loudness_target
args.info: The overall loudness of a track in decibels (dB). Loudness values are averaged across the entire track and are useful for comparing relative loudness of tracks. Loudness is the quality of a sound that is the primary psychological correlate of physical strength (amplitude). Values typical range between -60 and 0 db.

args.name: mode_min
args.info: Mode indicates the modality (major or minor) of a track, the type of scale from which its melodic content is derived. Major is represented by 1 and minor is 0.

args.name: mode_max
args.info: Mode indicates the modality (major or minor) of a track, the type of scale from which its melodic content is derived. Major is represented by 1 and minor is 0.

args.name: mode_target
args.info: Mode indicates the modality (major or minor) of a track, the type of scale from which its melodic content is derived. Major is represented by 1 and minor is 0.

args.name: popularity_min
args.info: The popularity of the track. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.

args.name: popularity_max
args.info: The popularity of the track. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.

args.name: popularity_target
args.info: The popularity of the track. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.

args.name: speechiness_min
args.info: Speechiness detects the presence of spoken words in a track. The more exclusively speech-like the recording (e.g. talk show, audio book, poetry), the closer to 1.0 the attribute value.

args.name: speechiness_max
args.info: Speechiness detects the presence of spoken words in a track. The more exclusively speech-like the recording (e.g. talk show, audio book, poetry), the closer to 1.0 the attribute value.

args.name: speechiness_target
args.info: Speechiness detects the presence of spoken words in a track. The more exclusively speech-like the recording (e.g. talk show, audio book, poetry), the closer to 1.0 the attribute value.

args.name: tempo_min
args.info: The overall estimated tempo of a track in beats per minute (BPM).

args.name: tempo_max
args.info: The overall estimated tempo of a track in beats per minute (BPM).

args.name: tempo_target
args.info: The overall estimated tempo of a track in beats per minute (BPM).

args.name: time_signature_min
args.info: An estimated overall time signature of a track. The time signature (meter) is a notational convention to specify how many beats are in each bar (or measure).

args.name: time_signature_max
args.info: An estimated overall time signature of a track. The time signature (meter) is a notational convention to specify how many beats are in each bar (or measure).

args.name: time_signature_target
args.info: An estimated overall time signature of a track. The time signature (meter) is a notational convention to specify how many beats are in each bar (or measure).

args.name: valence_min
args.info: A measure from 0.0 to 1.0 describing the musical positiveness conveyed by a track.

args.name: valence_max
args.info: A measure from 0.0 to 1.0 describing the musical positiveness conveyed by a track.

args.name: valence_target
args.info: A measure from 0.0 to 1.0 describing the musical positiveness conveyed by a track.
